Class BucketSort

  • java.lang.Object
    • BucketSort

  • public class BucketSort
extends java.lang.Object
    BucketSort class contains methods for implementing the bucket sort algorithm using a 2D array:
    Author:
    conorhenry

      • BucketSort

        Parameters:
        toSort - - unsorted int array to be sorted by sort method

    • Method Detail

      • sort

        public int[] sort()
        sort() method implements the BucketSort algorithm specified in the book: "a) Place each value of the one-dimensional array into a row of the bucket array, based on the value’s “ones” (rightmost) digit. For example, 97 is placed in row 7, 3 is placed in row 3 and 100 is placed in row 0. This procedure is called a distribution pass. b) Loop through the bucket array row by row, and copy the values back to the original array. This procedure is called a gathering pass. The new order of the preceding values in the one-dimensional array is 100, 3 and 97. c) Repeat this process for each subsequent digit position (tens, hundreds, thousands, etc.). On the second (tens digit) pass, 100 is placed in row 0, 3 is placed in row 0 (because 3 has no tens digit) and 97 is placed in row 9. After the gathering pass, the order of the values in the one-dimensional array is 100, 3 and 97. On the third (hundreds digit) pass, 100 is placed in row 1, 3 is placed in row 0 and 97 is placed in row 0 (after the 3). After this last gathering pass, the original array is in sorted order.
        Returns:
        clone result array- the sorted array"

      • distribute

        public void distribute()
        Handles the distribution pass of the algorithm as specified by the book: "Place each value of the one-dimensional array into a row of the bucket array, based on the value’s “ones” (rightmost) digit. For example, 97 is placed in row 7, 3 is placed in row 3 and 100 is placed in row 0. This procedure is called a distribution pass."

      • gather

        public void gather()
        Handles the gathering pass of the algorithm specified in the book: "Loop through the bucket array row by row, and copy the values back to the original array. This procedure is called a gathering pass. The new order of the preceding values in the one-dimensional array is 100, 3 and 97."

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overridden toString method to display resultArr and buckets to show the progress of the sorting algorithm or for debugging purposes
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String containing resultArr and buckets

      • getDigit

        public static int getDigit(java.lang.Integer number,
                           int digit)
        getDigit() method finds the n'th least significant digit of an integer
        Parameters:
        number - Integer to get the nth digit of
        digit - refers to a particular digit in the number. i.e. n=1: the one's place, n=2: the ten's place
        Returns:
        the integer form of the n'th least significant digit of number
